sci:arg.name: Tempfiles
sci:arg.sci:help:
A comma delimited list of global properties, each of which will automatically hold the name of a file in the job's temporary folder, whose name is guaranteed to be unique.

For each global name, an additional global is created (with the suffix _Filename) that hold just the leaf file name of the temporary file.

sci:arg.name: DeclareLocal
sci:arg.sci:help:
Lists a set of properties (without the @) to create on the global property list for this subprotocol. Such properties can only be accessed within the scope of this subprotocol and its descendent subprotocols.

Any global property not declared in this way is created on the top level global property list and is accessible from all protocols, but may collide with another property of the same name.

Scoping global properties to the subprotocol where they are used is highly recommended.

sci:arg.name: RunToCompletion
sci:arg.sci:help:
When RunToCompletion is set to "True - For Each Data Record", the subprotocol is re-initialized and executed in its entirety for each individual data record it processes.

When set to "True - For Each Category", the data records are divided into categories based on the value of the Categorize Using parameter and then the subprotocol is re-initialized and executed in its entirety for each category of data records. When used in conjunction with Parallel Processing Options, each category of data records will be sent to the remote server as part of one single batch.

sci:arg.name: RunToCompletion Categorize Using
sci:arg.sci:help: Required when RunToCompletion is set to True - For Each Category, this parameter specifies the property or properties used to define the categories.
sci:arg.sci:validscript: SetInvalidDetails('This parameter is required when RunToCompletion is set to True - For Each Category'); Parameter() ne '';
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails('To Enable, Set RunToCompletion to True - For Each Category'); Parameter('RunToCompletion') eq 'True - For Each Category';

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options
sci:arg.sci:help:
When set to True, this set of options allow the subprotocol to execute in parallel on one or more independent Pipeline Pilot servers, running local or remote. Additional parameters control the number of data records to send in each process batch, the list of Pipeline Pilot servers to use, the number of protocol processes that can be executed on each server, and whether to preserve the order of the processed data records.

Use this option judiciously, since it will not increase throughput in all circumstances. In general, it will yield improved performance when the parallelization benefits outweigh the data transfer overhead for the specified batch size. As a rough guide, performance can be improved when each individual batch requires at least 10 seconds to execute, although this can be affected by the size of each data record.

When running the protocol with debugging, the subprotocol will provide debugging messages to detail each of the various steps of execution. Also, components located within the parallel subprotocol will display their debugging messages as well.

For more information on the parallel subprotocol options, see Parallel Processing Subprotocols.

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options Batch Size
sci:arg.sci:help:
The number of records to send to the remote server(s) for each subprotocol execution. In general, performance is optimized when the amount of time required to process each batch is at least 10 seconds (note that this can vary depending on the characteristics of the remote server's hardware). Use a batch size of -1 to pass all data in a single batch.

When RunToCompletion is set to "True - for each category", the batch sizes will be determined by the number of records in each individual category. Therefore, the Batch Size parameter is not applicable.

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options Server
sci:arg.sci:help:
Comma separated list of Pipeline Pilot servers on which to execute the parallel subprotocol. The server names should be in the same format as the Pipeline Pilot Client's change server dialog (server-name:port-number).

Specifying localhost as a server will cause the subprotocol to use its own Pipeline Pilot server. This can be helpful on multi-CPU/multi-core systems (where the subprotocol jobs are spawned on the same machine) and Pipeline Pilot Linux clusters (where 'localhost' requests spawning the subprotocol jobs on the same cluster).
sci:arg.sci:member: Parallel Processing Options Server Run On Grid
sci:arg.sci:validscript: SetInvalidDetails('This parameter is required.'); Parameter() ne '';
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails("This parameter is only applicable if 'Parallel Processing Options' is 'True'"); Parameter('Parallel Processing Options');

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options Server Processes
sci:arg.sci:help: Comma separated list of maximum number of batches that can be simultaneously executed on each remote server. The number of entries in this parameter must equal the number of servers. If '*' is specified as the number of processes, then that server will only launch as many batches as the administrator of the remote server has permitted.
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails("This parameter is only applicable if 'Parallel Processing Options' is 'True'"); Parameter('Parallel Processing Options');

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options Server Run On Grid
sci:arg.sci:help: Run subprotocol on grid engine if available.
sci:arg.sci:member: Parallel Processing Options Server Run On Grid Queue Name
Parallel Processing Options Server Run On Grid Grid Options
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: parameter('Parallel Processing Options');

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options Server Run On Grid Queue Name
sci:arg.sci:help: Select the queue name on the grid to submit jobs to. Leave blank to use default queue name.
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: parameter('Parallel Processing Options Server Run On Grid');

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options Server Run On Grid Grid Options
sci:arg.sci:help: Use this to specify grid engine specific command line parameters to the job submission command. Leave blank to use defaults.
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: parameter('Parallel Processing Options Server Run On Grid');

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options Preserve Order
sci:arg.sci:help: Whether to preserve the order of the data as it enters and leaves the remote subprotocol.
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails("This parameter is only applicable if 'Parallel Processing Options' is 'True'"); Parameter('Parallel Processing Options');

sci:arg.sci:help: Component Attributes

sci:arg.name: ProtocolAutoLayout
sci:arg.sci:help: Protocol AutoLayout

sci:arg.name: ComponentRevision
sci:arg.sci:help: Component Revision

sci:arg.name: ByReference
sci:arg.sci:help: By Ref

sci:arg.name: ComponentHelp
sci:arg.sci:value: A tab group is a section of content organized in tabs, activated by a menu. Pipe tabs into this component.
Records passing out of any unconnected pass ports of components inside the subprotocol
Records passing out of any unconnected fail ports of components inside the subprotocol

sci:arg.sci:help: The server version when this component was registered

sci:arg.sci:help: Protocol Scale

sci:arg.name: Protocol Options
sci:arg.sci:help: Protocol Options

sci:arg.name: Registrant
sci:arg.sci:help: The user who registered this component.

sci:arg.name: RegistrationDate
sci:arg.sci:help: The date this component was registered.

sci:arg.sci:help: Local Component Identifier

sci:arg.sci:help: Processing Order

sci:arg.sci:help: The original path within the database of this component.

sci:arg.sci:help: Protocol AutoLayout

sci:arg.name: ComponentRevision
sci:arg.sci:help: Component Revision

sci:arg.name: ByReference
sci:arg.sci:help: By Ref

sci:arg.name: ComponentHelp
sci:arg.sci:value:
Use a subprotocol to collapse one or more components into a single item. Open a subprotocol to view or edit its contents.

To define input and output ports, display icon, and parameter settings, right-click and select Edit. You can save subprotocols and reuse them. For more information, see the User Guide help for Subprotocols Overview.

For more information on the parallel subprotocol options, see Parallel Processing Subprotocols.

Tip: Any component can be made into a shortcut, so that the latest version is always used. For more information, see Creating Shortcuts.
Records passing out of any unconnected pass ports of components inside the subprotocol
Records passing out of any unconnected fail ports of components inside the subprotocol

sci:arg.name: DataActionOnError
sci:arg.sci:help: When a General or DataType error occurs during processing: LeaveData: The data is passed unalterd ClearData: The data is cleared before being passed (an empty data item) DeleteData: The data is deleted and not passed

sci:arg.name: ComponentAttributes
sci:arg.sci:help: Component Attributes

sci:arg.name: Action
sci:arg.sci:help: the action to perform

sci:arg.name: Port
sci:arg.sci:help: the port to pass data to

sci:arg.name: Registrant
sci:arg.sci:help: The user who registered this component.

sci:arg.name: RegistrationDate
sci:arg.sci:help: The date this component was registered.

sci:arg.name: DerivedFrom
sci:arg.sci:help: The component this component is based upon.

sci:arg.name: ComponentHelp
sci:arg.sci:value: Sends all incoming records out the Pass port unchanged

Useful in subprotocols to capture the point of input. For example, if you wish to perform two different sequences of operations on the same input data, use No-op as the first component of the subprotocol and connect both pipes to the No-op output port.

You can also use this component to simplify the layout for complex protocols. For example, if you have three Reader components that need to be connected to three Viewer components, placing a No-op in the middle reduces the number of required connections and clarifies the logic.

sci:arg.name: RegistrationVersion
sci:arg.sci:help: The server version when this component was registered

sci:arg.sci:help: Local Component Identifier

sci:arg.sci:help: Processing Order

sci:arg.name: OriginalPackage
sci:arg.sci:help: OriginalPackage

sci:arg.name: SubProtocolModified
sci:arg.sci:help: Subprotocol Modified

sci:arg.name: ByReference
sci:arg.sci:help: By Ref

sci:arg.name: SubProtocolMadeLinkIntoCopy
sci:arg.sci:help: Subprotocol Made Link Into Copy

sci:arg.name: Component Path
sci:arg.sci:help: The original path within the database of this component.

sci:arg.name: Tempfiles
sci:arg.sci:help:
A comma delimited list of global properties, each of which will automatically hold the name of a file in the job's temporary folder, whose name is guaranteed to be unique.

For each global name, an additional global is created (with the suffix _Filename) that hold just the leaf file name of the temporary file.

sci:arg.name: DeclareLocal
sci:arg.sci:help:
Lists a set of properties (without the @) to create on the global property list for this subprotocol. Such properties can only be accessed within the scope of this subprotocol and its descendent subprotocols.

Any global property not declared in this way is created on the top level global property list and is accessible from all protocols, but may collide with another property of the same name.

Scoping global properties to the subprotocol where they are used is highly recommended.

sci:arg.name: RunToCompletion
sci:arg.sci:help:
When RunToCompletion is set to "True - For Each Data Record", the subprotocol is re-initialized and executed in its entirety for each individual data record it processes.

When set to "True - For Each Category", the data records are divided into categories based on the value of the Categorize Using parameter and then the subprotocol is re-initialized and executed in its entirety for each category of data records. When used in conjunction with Parallel Processing Options, each category of data records will be sent to the remote server as part of one single batch.

sci:arg.name: RunToCompletion Categorize Using
sci:arg.sci:help: Required when RunToCompletion is set to True - For Each Category, this parameter specifies the property or properties used to define the categories.
sci:arg.sci:validscript: SetInvalidDetails('This parameter is required when RunToCompletion is set to True - For Each Category'); Parameter() ne '';
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails('To Enable, Set RunToCompletion to True - For Each Category'); Parameter('RunToCompletion') eq 'True - For Each Category';

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options
sci:arg.sci:help:
When set to True, this set of options allow the subprotocol to execute in parallel on one or more independent Pipeline Pilot servers, running local or remote. Additional parameters control the number of data records to send in each process batch, the list of Pipeline Pilot servers to use, the number of protocol processes that can be executed on each server, and whether to preserve the order of the processed data records.

Use this option judiciously, since it will not increase throughput in all circumstances. In general, it will yield improved performance when the parallelization benefits outweigh the data transfer overhead for the specified batch size. As a rough guide, performance can be improved when each individual batch requires at least 10 seconds to execute, although this can be affected by the size of each data record.

When running the protocol with debugging, the subprotocol will provide debugging messages to detail each of the various steps of execution. Also, components located within the parallel subprotocol will display their debugging messages as well.

For more information on the parallel subprotocol options, see Parallel Processing Subprotocols.

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options Batch Size
sci:arg.sci:help:
The number of records to send to the remote server(s) for each subprotocol execution. In general, performance is optimized when the amount of time required to process each batch is at least 10 seconds (note that this can vary depending on the characteristics of the remote server's hardware). Use a batch size of -1 to pass all data in a single batch.

When RunToCompletion is set to "True - for each category", the batch sizes will be determined by the number of records in each individual category. Therefore, the Batch Size parameter is not applicable.

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options Server
sci:arg.sci:help:
Comma separated list of Pipeline Pilot servers on which to execute the parallel subprotocol. The server names should be in the same format as the Pipeline Pilot Client's change server dialog (server-name:port-number).

Specifying localhost as a server will cause the subprotocol to use its own Pipeline Pilot server. This can be helpful on multi-CPU/multi-core systems (where the subprotocol jobs are spawned on the same machine) and Pipeline Pilot Linux clusters (where 'localhost' requests spawning the subprotocol jobs on the same cluster).
sci:arg.sci:member: Parallel Processing Options Server Run On Grid
sci:arg.sci:validscript: SetInvalidDetails('This parameter is required.'); Parameter() ne '';
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails("This parameter is only applicable if 'Parallel Processing Options' is 'True'"); Parameter('Parallel Processing Options');

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options Server Processes
sci:arg.sci:help: Comma separated list of maximum number of batches that can be simultaneously executed on each remote server. The number of entries in this parameter must equal the number of servers. If '*' is specified as the number of processes, then that server will only launch as many batches as the administrator of the remote server has permitted.
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails("This parameter is only applicable if 'Parallel Processing Options' is 'True'"); Parameter('Parallel Processing Options');

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options Server Run On Grid
sci:arg.sci:help: Run subprotocol on grid engine if available.
sci:arg.sci:member: Parallel Processing Options Server Run On Grid Queue Name
Parallel Processing Options Server Run On Grid Grid Options
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: parameter('Parallel Processing Options');

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options Server Run On Grid Queue Name
sci:arg.sci:help: Select the queue name on the grid to submit jobs to. Leave blank to use default queue name.
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: parameter('Parallel Processing Options Server Run On Grid');

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options Server Run On Grid Grid Options
sci:arg.sci:help: Use this to specify grid engine specific command line parameters to the job submission command. Leave blank to use defaults.
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: parameter('Parallel Processing Options Server Run On Grid');

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options Preserve Order
sci:arg.sci:help: Whether to preserve the order of the data as it enters and leaves the remote subprotocol.
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails("This parameter is only applicable if 'Parallel Processing Options' is 'True'"); Parameter('Parallel Processing Options');

sci:arg.name: ComponentAttributes
sci:arg.sci:help: Component Attributes

sci:arg.name: ProtocolAutoLayout
sci:arg.sci:help: Protocol AutoLayout

sci:arg.name: ComponentRevision
sci:arg.sci:help: Component Revision

sci:arg.name: ByReference
sci:arg.sci:help: By Ref

sci:arg.name: ComponentHelp
sci:arg.sci:value:
Use a subprotocol to collapse one or more components into a single item. Open a subprotocol to view or edit its contents.

To define input and output ports, display icon, and parameter settings, right-click and select Edit. You can save subprotocols and reuse them. For more information, see the User Guide help for Subprotocols Overview.

For more information on the parallel subprotocol options, see Parallel Processing Subprotocols.

Tip: Any component can be made into a shortcut, so that the latest version is always used. For more information, see Creating Shortcuts.
Records passing out of any unconnected pass ports of components inside the subprotocol
Records passing out of any unconnected fail ports of components inside the subprotocol

sci:arg.name: RegistrationVersion
sci:arg.sci:help: The server version when this component was registered

sci:arg.name: Protocol Sticky Notes
sci:arg.sci:help: Protocol Sticky Notes

sci:arg.name: ProtocolScale2
sci:arg.sci:help: Protocol Scale

sci:arg.name: Protocol Options
sci:arg.sci:help: Protocol Options

sci:arg.name: Registrant
sci:arg.sci:help: The user who registered this component.

sci:arg.name: RegistrationDate
sci:arg.sci:help: The date this component was registered.

sci:arg.name: ComponentLocalID
sci:arg.sci:help: Local Component Identifier

sci:arg.name: Component Path
sci:arg.sci:help: The original path within the database of this component.

sci:arg.name: Additional Options
sci:arg.sci:help: Contains less commonly used parameters

sci:arg.name: GroupName
sci:arg.sci:help: (Optional) Restricts the ungroup process to only those groups having the given name -- the same name as specified by the "Group Data" component

sci:arg.name: ComponentAttributes
sci:arg.sci:help: Component Attributes

sci:arg.name: Registrant
sci:arg.sci:help: The user who registered this component.

sci:arg.name: RegistrationDate
sci:arg.sci:help: The date this component was registered.

sci:arg.name: DerivedFrom
sci:arg.sci:help: The component this component is based upon.

sci:arg.name: ComponentHelp
sci:arg.sci:value: Separates data records previously grouped together into the original records

The input record is assumed to be a grouped data record. The individual records are extracted from the group and sent out the Pass port. The incoming data record is discarded.

You would typically use Ungroup Data as the first component inside a RunToCompletion subprotocol that expects grouped data. This executes the remainder of the subprotocol over the individual data records in the group.

Note:
  • It is possible to have a group which in turn has another group as one of its members (nested groups). In this case, ungrouping will separate only the top level groups. Multiple Ungroup Data components operating in series are needed to separate nested groups.
See Also:
  • To group data records together use Group Data by Tag or Group Data by Number.
  • To view the structure of grouped data records use Data Record Tree Viewer
  • To learn more about RunToCompletion subprotocols, see the parameter help on Subprotocol.
Data records with a hierarchical group of other data records
The individual data records that were contained within a hierarchical group of the incoming data
Data records on which the GroupName property is missing

sci:arg.name: RegistrationVersion
sci:arg.sci:help: The server version when this component was registered

sci:arg.name: ComponentLocalID
sci:arg.sci:help: Local Component Identifier

sci:arg.name: Component Path
sci:arg.sci:help: The original path within the database of this component.

sci:arg.name: List
sci:arg.sci:help: A list of which data records to pass: e.g., 1,3-5,7,10-11 will pass the first, third, fourth, fifth and so on.

sci:arg.name: ComponentAttributes
sci:arg.sci:help: Component Attributes

sci:arg.name: Registrant
sci:arg.sci:help: The user who registered this component.

sci:arg.name: RegistrationDate
sci:arg.sci:help: The date this component was registered.

sci:arg.name: ComponentAutoDisplayName
sci:arg.sci:help: Automatically update the component display name when the "List" property is changed. This feature is turned off after the user manually changes the display name of the component in Protocol workspace.

sci:arg.name: DerivedFrom
sci:arg.sci:help: The component this component is based upon.

sci:arg.name: ComponentHelp
sci:arg.sci:value: Passes data records within a specified range based on the order in which they arrive

Data records are numbered consecutively (from 1) as they arrive at the component. The record numbers specified by List are sent out the Pass port. Records not specified are sent out the Fail port.

List items need to be entered as comma-separated values. List can accept single item indices or ranges (such as "1-5,7,9,13-15").
Data records whose indices match the specified list
Data records whose indices do not match the specified list

sci:arg.name: ComponentLocalID
sci:arg.sci:help: Local Component Identifier

sci:arg.name: Component Path
sci:arg.sci:help: The original path within the database of this component.

sci:arg.name: Additional Options
sci:arg.sci:help: Contains less commonly used parameters

sci:arg.name: GroupName
sci:arg.sci:help: (Optional) Restricts the ungroup process to only those groups having the given name -- the same name as specified by the "Group Data" component

The input record is assumed to be a grouped data record. The individual records are extracted from the group and sent out the Pass port. The incoming data record is discarded.

You would typically use Ungroup Data as the first component inside a RunToCompletion subprotocol that expects grouped data. This executes the remainder of the subprotocol over the individual data records in the group.

Note:
  • It is possible to have a group which in turn has another group as one of its members (nested groups). In this case, ungrouping will separate only the top level groups. Multiple Ungroup Data components operating in series are needed to separate nested groups.
See Also:
  • To group data records together use Group Data by Tag or Group Data by Number.
  • To view the structure of grouped data records use Data Record Tree Viewer
  • To learn more about RunToCompletion subprotocols, see the parameter help on Subprotocol.
Data records with a hierarchical group of other data records
The individual data records that were contained within a hierarchical group of the incoming data
Data records on which the GroupName property is missing

sci:arg.sci:help: The server version when this component was registered

sci:arg.name: ComponentLocalID
sci:arg.sci:help: Local Component Identifier

sci:arg.name: Component Path
sci:arg.sci:help: The original path within the database of this component.

sci:arg.name: DataActionOnError
sci:arg.sci:help: When a General or DataType error occurs during processing: LeaveData: The data is passed unalterd ClearData: The data is cleared before being passed (an empty data item) DeleteData: The data is deleted and not passed

sci:arg.name: ComponentAttributes
sci:arg.sci:help: Component Attributes

sci:arg.name: Action
sci:arg.sci:help: the action to perform

sci:arg.name: Port
sci:arg.sci:help: the port to pass data to

sci:arg.name: Registrant
sci:arg.sci:help: The user who registered this component.

sci:arg.name: RegistrationDate
sci:arg.sci:help: The date this component was registered.

sci:arg.name: DerivedFrom
sci:arg.sci:help: The component this component is based upon.

sci:arg.name: ComponentHelp
sci:arg.sci:value: Directs records to the Fail port for use in subprotocol building.
Useful in a subprotocol for directing records that are passing through components in the subprotocol to the Fail port of the subprotocol.

sci:arg.name: RegistrationVersion
sci:arg.sci:help: The server version when this component was registered

sci:arg.name: ComponentLocalID
sci:arg.sci:help: Local Component Identifier

sci:arg.name: Component Path
sci:arg.sci:help: The original path within the database of this component.
sci:arg.sci:value: Components\Data Access and Manipulation\Utilities\Subprotocol Utilities\Data to Fail Port

sci:arg.name: Statistics
sci:arg.sci:help: The statistics to calculate

sci:arg.name: Percentiles
sci:arg.sci:help: Comma-separated list of the percentiles to output when Percentile is selected as one of the Statistics. Values are in percentages (as opposed to fractions).
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: contains(Parameter('Statistics'), 'Percentile')

sci:arg.name: Percentile Type
sci:arg.sci:help:
Method to use for computing percentiles. Options are:
  • Excel: Method used by Excel. Equivalent to the R type 7 method (see link below), which is the default in R.
  • NIST: Method recommended in the NIST Engineering Statistics Handbook (see link below). Equivalent to the R type 6 method. Also used by Minitab and SPSS.
  • Closest Value: Returns the value from the input data whose sorted index is the lowest index greater than or equal to N*p/100, where N is the number of data points and p is the percentile level. Equivalent to the R type 1 method.
  • R Type 2: R type 2 method. Similar to "Closest Value" but with averaging at discontinuities.
  • R Type 3: R type 3 method. Also used by SAS.
  • R Type 4: R type 4 method. Linear interpolation of the empirical cumulative distribution function.
  • R Type 5: R type 5 method. According to R documentation, "popular amongst hydrologists."
  • R Type 8: R type 8 method. Recommended by Hyndman and Fan (see link below to R documentation).
  • R Type 9: R type 9 method. According to R documentation, "resulting quantile estimates are approximately unbiased for the expected order statistics if x is normally distributed."
See Also:
  • For more information on these options, see the R documentation for the quantile function, the article from the NIST Engineering Statistics Handbook on percentiles, and the Wikipedia article on percentiles.
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: contains(Parameter('Statistics'), 'Percentile')

sci:arg.name: UseProperties
sci:arg.sci:help:
The applicable input properties for this component:
  • AllPropertiesOnFirstData: Uses all those that are found on the first data object.
  • UserSet: Takes the list of properties from the parameter UserSet. Property ranges can be given by providing the first and last property in the range separated by a hyphen. Properties can be referred to by index by using the word "Column" followed by the index, such as "Column3-Column10".

sci:arg.name: UserSet
sci:arg.sci:help:
A comma-separated list of properties to use for calculating statistics.

If an item on the list contains a hyphen (e.g., "X1-X5"), and the properties on either side of the hyphen (e.g., "X1", "X5") are defined on the first data record, then all properties in that range are included. Note that the properties within the specified range are determined by the order of properties in the property list. Thus, if properties in the property list are in the following order: X1, X2, X5, X3, X4, X6, then the range "X1-X5" will only include properties X1, X2, and X5.
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails('To enable, set UseProperties to UserSet'); Parameter('UseProperties') eq 'UserSet'

sci:arg.name: IgnoreProperties
sci:arg.sci:help: A comma-separated list of properties to ignore. This is used, for example, if the UseProperties parameter is set to "AllPropertiesOnFirstData", and there is a small set of undesirable properties (such as record names) you do not want to use, but cannot remove.

sci:arg.name: OutputResults
sci:arg.sci:help:
Specifies results to output. Options are:
  • As Summary: Output is a single data record containing the computed statistics.
  • On Original Data: Each input data record is output along with with the statistics computed over all data records.
  • As Running Tally: Each input data record is output along with the statistics computed over all data records up to that point.

sci:arg.name: ComponentAttributes
sci:arg.sci:help: Component Attributes

sci:arg.name: GenerateStatisticsAcross
sci:arg.sci:help: GenerateStatisticsAcross

sci:arg.name: Registrant
sci:arg.sci:help: The user who registered this component.

sci:arg.name: RegistrationDate
sci:arg.sci:help: The date this component was registered.

sci:arg.name: DerivedFrom
sci:arg.sci:help: The component this component is based upon.

sci:arg.name: ComponentHelp
sci:arg.sci:value: Calculates statistics for specified properties over all data records

Use Statistics to specify the statistical quantities you wish to calculate. You can choose any or all of the following:
  • Mean: Sum of values divided by number of values.
  • StdDev: Standard deviation if sample represents entire population. (Square-root of 1/N times sum of squared deviation from mean.)
  • StdDevSample: Sample standard deviation. (Square-root of 1/(N-1) times sum of squared deviation from mean. This is the square-root of the unbiased estimator of the population variance if the sample is a subset of a larger population).
  • N: Number of values.
  • Variance: Variance of values if sample represents entire population; square of StdDev.
  • Skew: Skew of values.
  • Kurtosis: Kurtosis of values (excess kurtosis relative to a Gaussian).
  • Sum: Sum of values.
  • Min: Minimum value.
  • Max: Maximum value.
  • Median: Median value.
  • Mode: Most common value.
  • GeometricMean: The N-th root of the product of N values.
  • MAD: Median Absolute Deviation, the median of the absolute value of the difference between each data point and the median of the data points.
  • Percentile: Percentile values specified by Percentiles.

Each property in each input data record may have one or multiple values. Statistics are calculated over all values for all records. For each statistic, a new property name is created by appending an underscore and the statistic name to the original property name. For percentiles, the number specifying the percentile level is appended to the name as well.

Use OutputResults to specify whether you wish to output only the statistics ("As Summary") or to add the statistics to the original data records ("On Original Data"). Note that in the latter case, the same value for each statistic will appear on each record, as the statistics are computed over all records. Alternatively, choose "As Running Tally" to output each original data record along with the statistical quantities computed over all records up to that point.

Note:

  • Common usage of the term "sample standard deviation" (or "sample variance") is inconsistent in that it sometimes refers to the form with N in the denominator, as here, and sometimes to the form with N-1 in the denominator, as here. The distinction is usually not important in that "for small sample sizes both are inaccurate and for large values of N they are practically the same."
Data records augmented with the requested statistics
Data records with missing or invalid values for all properties whose statistics are being calculated

sci:arg.name: RegistrationVersion
sci:arg.sci:help: The server version when this component was registered

sci:arg.name: ComponentLocalID
sci:arg.sci:help: Local Component Identifier

sci:arg.name: Component Path
sci:arg.sci:help: The original path within the database of this component.
sci:arg.sci:value: Components\Analysis and Statistics\Basic Math and Statistics\Basic Statistics

sci:arg.name: Tempfiles
sci:arg.sci:help:
A comma delimited list of global properties, each of which will automatically hold the name of a file in the job's temporary folder, whose name is guaranteed to be unique.

For each global name, an additional global is created (with the suffix _Filename) that hold just the leaf file name of the temporary file.

sci:arg.name: DeclareLocal
sci:arg.sci:help:
Lists a set of properties (without the @) to create on the global property list for this subprotocol. Such properties can only be accessed within the scope of this subprotocol and its descendent subprotocols.

Any global property not declared in this way is created on the top level global property list and is accessible from all protocols, but may collide with another property of the same name.

Scoping global properties to the subprotocol where they are used is highly recommended.

sci:arg.name: RunToCompletion
sci:arg.sci:help:
When RunToCompletion is set to "True - For Each Data Record", the subprotocol is re-initialized and executed in its entirety for each individual data record it processes.

When set to "True - For Each Category", the data records are divided into categories based on the value of the Categorize Using parameter and then the subprotocol is re-initialized and executed in its entirety for each category of data records. When used in conjunction with Parallel Processing Options, each category of data records will be sent to the remote server as part of one single batch.

sci:arg.name: RunToCompletion Categorize Using
sci:arg.sci:help: Required when RunToCompletion is set to True - For Each Category, this parameter specifies the property or properties used to define the categories.
sci:arg.sci:validscript: SetInvalidDetails('This parameter is required when RunToCompletion is set to True - For Each Category'); Parameter() ne '';
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails('To Enable, Set RunToCompletion to True - For Each Category'); Parameter('RunToCompletion') eq 'True - For Each Category';

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options
sci:arg.sci:help:
When set to True, this set of options allow the subprotocol to execute in parallel on one or more independent Pipeline Pilot servers, running local or remote. Additional parameters control the number of data records to send in each process batch, the list of Pipeline Pilot servers to use, the number of protocol processes that can be executed on each server, and whether to preserve the order of the processed data records.

Use this option judiciously, since it will not increase throughput in all circumstances. In general, it will yield improved performance when the parallelization benefits outweigh the data transfer overhead for the specified batch size. As a rough guide, performance can be improved when each individual batch requires at least 10 seconds to execute, although this can be affected by the size of each data record.

When running the protocol with debugging, the subprotocol will provide debugging messages to detail each of the various steps of execution. Also, components located within the parallel subprotocol will display their debugging messages as well.

For more information on the parallel subprotocol options, see Parallel Processing Subprotocols.

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options Batch Size
sci:arg.sci:help:
The number of records to send to the remote server(s) for each subprotocol execution. In general, performance is optimized when the amount of time required to process each batch is at least 10 seconds (note that this can vary depending on the characteristics of the remote server's hardware). Use a batch size of -1 to pass all data in a single batch.

When RunToCompletion is set to "True - for each category", the batch sizes will be determined by the number of records in each individual category. Therefore, the Batch Size parameter is not applicable.

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options Server
sci:arg.sci:help:
Comma separated list of Pipeline Pilot servers on which to execute the parallel subprotocol. The server names should be in the same format as the Pipeline Pilot Client's change server dialog (server-name:port-number).

Specifying localhost as a server will cause the subprotocol to use its own Pipeline Pilot server. This can be helpful on multi-CPU/multi-core systems (where the subprotocol jobs are spawned on the same machine) and Pipeline Pilot Linux clusters (where 'localhost' requests spawning the subprotocol jobs on the same cluster).
sci:arg.sci:member: Parallel Processing Options Server Run On Grid
sci:arg.sci:validscript: SetInvalidDetails('This parameter is required.'); Parameter() ne '';
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails("This parameter is only applicable if 'Parallel Processing Options' is 'True'"); Parameter('Parallel Processing Options');

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options Server Processes
sci:arg.sci:help: Comma separated list of maximum number of batches that can be simultaneously executed on each remote server. The number of entries in this parameter must equal the number of servers. If '*' is specified as the number of processes, then that server will only launch as many batches as the administrator of the remote server has permitted.
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails("This parameter is only applicable if 'Parallel Processing Options' is 'True'"); Parameter('Parallel Processing Options');

sci:arg.sci:help: Run subprotocol on grid engine if available.

sci:arg.sci:help: Select the queue name on the grid to submit jobs to. Leave blank to use default queue name.

sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails("This parameter is only applicable if 'Parallel Processing Options' is 'True'"); Parameter('Parallel Processing Options');

sci:arg.name: Protocol Sticky Notes
sci:arg.sci:help: Protocol Sticky Notes
sci:arg.sci:value: WARNING! This is a Pipeline Pilot protocol written in version 8.0 or later. It contains features that are not supported in earlier versions of Pipeline Pilot.
